comment: TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!! I promise you I was dreading this class, but every exam is 2 attempts. No lockdown. Quizzes and Exams are your only grades and a self introduction, the pacing isn't bad either you have time within the weeks to do other classes as well. She's also very easily reachable.

Like many, I dreaded this class!  Register with confidence by selecting this professor!  You are only graded on a few things, however, most are multiple choice quizzes (2 attempts, untimed), and a few quizzes by hand (graphs, Excel problems) and several exams.  No textbook needed, and she is very helpful with content if you reach out.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: If you have nightmares about taking this class, take this professor. Lectures are recorded online and YouTube videos are posted on many topics (she does have an accent but you get used to it). She really simplifies everything and most of it is done in Excel. Study guides are just like the quizzes/tests.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Not a lot of assignments so do well on the quizzes and exams and you'll pass. Quizzes and exams can be taken multiple times and it shows you the wrong answers so write down all your answers if you re-take them. Professor wants you to learn the material so always reach out to her if you are lost or ask on the discussion board.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class is a lot of work, and theres a lockdown and webcam!
Nice professor, easy class. Don't buy the book, you won't need it. She gives multiple attempts for each quiz and test and seems like she really wants you to do well.

Take her. This class is a very easy A. The five quizzes and three tests are untimed with multiple attempts for each one. The best score counts for the quizzes and tests. The final is untimed but with one attempt. She offered extra credit if you participated in the optional discussions. Don't bother to buy the book.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Currently taking her online- I absolutely FEARED this class, but she is very helpful and the assignments are so limited (that could be a good or bad thing I suppose) There are nothing but quizzes and tests, but they are fairly simple. Don't buy the textbook, not needed at all!

Class was pretty easy - her practice quizzes and tests are very similar/identical to the graded ones. You can find 95% of the answers to her tests and quizzes online anyway. Don't buy the book - I never opened it.

Her accent is sometimes tough to understand but she is a great teacher. Took her in class but tests are online in class. Quizzes give you multiple attempts and shows you the ones you missed after each attempt. If you are a good class she gives 2 attempts on final. Tough class but she simplifies it a little. Drops lowest test grade. offers bonus pts

I didn't make over a 75 on any test. But I made a B in the class.  Mainly for attendance points. Class is extremely boring. Total zone out. Do not buy the book.  Tests are nothing like review questions

Her class seems super pointless. She takes attendance. I would go in, write my name down for attendance, and leave. Testquizzes are identical to practice in class... I made an A without going to class..

Accept that you have to take  Econ 3300 so your screwed. There are no good professors at KSU for this class. Rudchenko has mandatory attendance. Her English skills are not good. Lectures are lengthy wastes of time. She'll get mad if you ask questions. She also has difficulty responding to questions. Tests are exactly like the quizes and practice.

EASY A. Has thick accent, easy to get used to it quickly. She is very helpful, & wants her students to do well. She is repetitive b/c she knows it's hard for students to understand her accent. Attendance is not mandatory, but HIGHLY recommended b/c You get 50 points just for signing in. Study guides/Quizzes are just like the exams. Don't buy book.

Definitely recommend taking her class. She offers numerous opportunities to succeed and really wants her students to understand the material. The material is hard and her accent is thick but she offers more then enough opportunities to pass and get extra credit. Thumbs up!

Easiest Math teacher ever.  Has a very thick accent, and the online, MyMathLab HW is kind of hard but you have unlimited attemtpts until the due date to get the right answer.  Her practice tests are 100% EXACTLY like her tests.  Her tests are also multiple choice. 3 tests and 1 final. Final is optional, or you can have it replace lowest test score.

Professor Rudchenko knows that she is hard to understand and that the material is tough. She REALLY wants her students to do well and gives MORE than enough help and practice to make sure you understand what she's teaching. She will personally sit with you until you understand the material. I would definitely take her again!
Nicest teacher!  Thick accent but you learn to understand her very quickly.  I definitely recommend taking her.
Quizzes, homework, and some tests online help to avoid simple mistakes.

She is rather hard to understand at first, but you get used to it. Sometimes she doesn't exactly understand what you're trying to ask, but she really tries. She's one of the sweetest professor's at KSU and I learned a lot in her class despite her thick accent.

Her accent is extremely thick and her English skills aren't 100% yet. For lectures, she basically reads the book out loud, and often fails to understand questions students ask. She does double jeopardy on exam questions and seems to arbitrarily take amounts of points off for simple mistakes. If you can read the book and teach yourself, your good.

She has a thick accent. However she knows how difficult it is to understand her and is fair about everything. She is a fair grader when it comes to quizzes (uses HW problems), tests, and homework (doesn't assign a lot of problems). Her lecture is straight out of the book. I recommend her.
